ygData.subject: URIs in frontier but not in queues
ygData.msgSnippet: I am currently running Heritrix 2 on two different Ubuntu servers. I am running crawls on both machines, and on each one I have one crawl where there are URIs

I am currently running Heritrix 2 on two different Ubuntu servers. I am run=
ning crawls on both machines, and on each one I have one crawl where there =
are URIs sitting in the frontier, but they are not in any active URI queue =
and don't show up in the frontier report as being in specific queues (they =
do show up in the Stats section as queued). All queues show retired, and th=
e crawl doesn't finish. 

In both crawls I had paused the crawl at a point =
and deleted some URIs using the Web interface, and the deletes ended up emp=
tying out some of the queues completely causing alerts like:

Oct 12, 2009 =
4:42:23 PM org.archive.crawler.frontier.AbstractFrontier managementTasks
SE=
VERE:  (in thread 'org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbFrontier@...=
Thread')
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.archive.crawler.fron=
tier.BdbMultipleWorkQueues.delete(BdbMultipleWorkQueues.java:483)
        a=
t org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbWorkQueue.deleteItem(BdbWorkQueue.java:91=
)
        at org.archive.crawler.frontier.WorkQueue.dequeue(WorkQueue.java:=
176)
        at org.archive.crawler.frontier.WorkQueueFrontier.processFinis=
h(WorkQueueFrontier.java:909)
        at org.archive.crawler.frontier.Abstr=
actFrontier$Finish.process(AbstractFrontier.java:1483)
        at org.archi=
ve.crawler.frontier.AbstractFrontier.managementTasks(AbstractFrontier.java:=
434)
        at org.archive.crawler.frontier.AbstractFrontier$2.run(Abstrac=
tFrontier.java:358)

My questions are:
1. How can I avoid the NullPointerEx=
ception when deleting everything in a queue? 
2. Is the NullPointerExceptio=
n what is causing the URIs in the frontier not to be put into queues? 
3. I=
s there any way to get a crawl such as these to a state where it can start =
processing what is sitting in the frontier? 

Please let me know if I need =
to share more information.

Thanks!
Lauren
